tuv.seg: The Irish Film Classification Office (IFCO), formerly called the Irish Film Censor's Office is responsible for examining all films, videos and DVDs intended for public distribution in Ireland. In addition, IFCO is responsible for certifying that they are fit to be viewed by members of the public

Tá dualgas ar an Oifig Aicmithe Scannán na hÉireann (OASÉ) gach scannán, fístéipeanna agus DVD, a bhfuil sé i gceist iad a scaipeadh ar an bpobal a scrúdú agus deimhniú go bhfuileadar sásúil le go mbeadh an pobal ag breathnú orthu
IFCO may prohibit a film, video or DVD or, more usually, classify it according to its suitability for different age groups
Is féidir leis an OASÉ cosc a chur ar scannán, fístéip nó DVD nó, is iondúil, go ndéantar iad a rangú de réir feiliúnachta do na haoisghrúpaí éagsúla

A film can be certified as unfit for viewing (in other words, banned) because IFCO is of the opinion that the film is likly to cause harm to children, or is indecent, obscene or blasphemous, or that viewing it might be contrary to, or undermine public morality

Is féidir a rá nach bhfuil scannán feiliúnach go mbeadh daoine ag breathnú air (i bhfocail eile, cosc curtha air) má bhíonn an OASÉ den tuairim go bhfuil an scannán mígheanasach, gáirsiúil nó diamhaslach nó go bhféadfadh sé a bheith in aghaidh nó in ann bonn a bhaint ón moráltacht phoiblí
IFCO may also rule that certain parts of a film must be removed before it can be certified for viewing
Is féidir leis an OASÉ freisin rialú nach mór píosaí faoi leith a bhaint as scannán sular féidir teastas a thabhairt dó
The Director of Film Classification must also view and approve the advertising material connected to the film to ensure it is appropriate
Ní mór don OASÉ freisin breathnú ar an ábhar bolscaireachta a bhaineann leis an scannán agus é a cheadú
A copy of the Certificate must be shown for at least 10 seconds immediately before the film is shown
Ní mór cóip den teastas a eisítear a thaispeáint ar feadh 10 soicind ar a laghad díreach roimh tús an scannáin
Censorship and private film clubs
Cinsireacht agus clubanna príobháideacha scannáin
Private film clubs (for example, the Irish Film Institute) are not obliged to seek classification for films that are shown only to their club members
Níl aon dualgas ar chlubanna príobháideacha scannáin (mar shampla Ionad Scannáin na hÉireann) scannáin a thaispeáintear do bhaill an chlub amháin a chur chuig an OASÉ le rangú
Film classifications currently in use
Rangú scannáin in úsáid faoi láthair
Irish film classifications are broadly similar to those in use in other countries
Déantar scannáin in Éirinn a rangú mórán ar an mbunús céanna le tíortha eile
Film trailers are also classified and may only be shown with a film of a similarly suitable classification
Déantar sleachta bolscaireachta ó scannáin a rangú freisin agus ní féidir iad a thaispeáint ach amháin nuair atá scannán den rangú céanna dhá thaispeáint
An overview of the current system of film classification for Ireland is as follows:
Mar seo a leanas atá forbhreathnú ar an gcóras reatha aicmithe scannán d’Éirinn:
• G (General): The film is suitable for everyone, including young children
• G (Ginearálta): Tá an scannán oiriúnach do gach duine, leanaí óga san áireamh
• PG (Parental Guidance): While the film may be watched by unaccompanied children, parental guidance is recommended as to its suitability for children under 12 years of age

• PG (Treoir Tuismitheora): Cé gur féidir le leanaí gan tionlacan tuismitheora féachaint ar an scannán, moltar go mbeadh treoir tuismitheora tugtha do leanaí faoi 12 bhliain d’aois maidir le hoiriúnacht an scannáin
The film may contain adult themes or concepts that parents may wish to be aware of
D’fhéadfadh téamaí nó coincheapa daoine fásta a bheith sa scannán gur mhaith le tuismitheoirí a bheith ar an eolas fúthu
If it has a romantic theme, it might have some sexual scenes or very brief nudity
Más téama rómánsúil atá i gceist, d’fhéadfadh go mbeadh radhairc ghnéasacha nó nochtacht ar feadh seal an-ghearr ann
It might also have some violence or mild bad language
Anuas air sin, d’fhéadfadh roinnt foréigin nó drochtheanga éadrom a bheith i gceist

• 12A: While the film is, in the opinion of IFCO, suitable only for people over 12 years of age, a person under that age may be admitted to see this film if he or she is accompanied by a parent or guardian

• 12A: Cé go bhfuil an scannán oiriúnach, i dtuairim an OASÉ, do dhaoine atá os cionn 12 bhliain d’aois amháin, is féidir duine atá faoi bliana d’aois a scaoileadh isteach le breathnú air má tá tuismitheoir nó caomhnóir in éineacht leis/léi

• 15A: While the film is, in the opinion of IFCO, suitable only for people over 15 years of age, a person under that age may be admitted to see this film if he or she is accompanied by a parent or guardian

• 15A: Cé go bhfuil an scannán oiriúnach, i dtuairim an OASÉ, do dhaoine atá os cionn 15 bliana d’aois amháin, is féidir duine atá faoi 15 bliana d’aois a scaoileadh isteach le breathnú air má tá tuismitheoir nó caomhnóir in éineacht leis/léi
• 16: Films classified in this category are considered to be suitable for persons of sixteen or over
• 16: Meastar go bhfuil scannáin a aicmítear sa chatagóir seo oiriúnach do dhaoine atá sé bliana déag d’aois nó os a chionn sin
Children under this age cannot be admitted to screenings
Ní féidir cead isteach a thabhairt do leanaí faoin aois seo chuig taispeáint an scannáin
Violent content and depicition of violence may be stronger than in films designated 15A
D’fhéadfadh ábhar foréigneach agus léiriú foréigin a bheith ní ba threise ná i scannáin a shainítear amhail 15A
• Over 18: Only people over the age of 18 may attend a screening of this film
• Os cionn 18: Ní féidir ach le daoine os cionn 18 mbliana freastal ar thaispeáint an scannáin seo
There will be adult themes and there may be explicit scenes of sex or violence
Beidh téamaí daoine fásta ann agus d’fhéadfadh go mbeadh radhairc de ghnéas nó d’fhoréigean ann
There may also be bad language, including strong sexual swear words
Anuas air sin, d’fhéadfadh drochtheanga, lena n-áirítear eascainí láidre gnéasacha
You can make a complaint about IFCO decisions on classification
Féadfaidh tú gearán a dhéanamh faoi chinntí an OASÉ maidir le haicmiú
If you are not satisfied with IFCO’s decision on your complaint you can escalate your complaint to the relevant Ombudsman
Mura bhfuil tú sásta le cinneadh an OASÉ ar do ghearán, féadfaidh tú do ghearán a chur faoi bhráid an Ombudsman ábhartha
For complaints regarding children contact the Office of the Ombudsman for Children, for all other complaints contact the Office of the Ombudsman
I dtaobh gearán a bhaineann le leanaí, déan teagmháil le hOifig an Ombudsman do Leanaí, i dtaobh na ngearán go léir eile, déan teagmháil le hOifig an Ombudsman
Censorship of Films Appeal Board
An Bord Achomhairc um Chinsireacht Scannán
The Classification of Films Appeal Board has 9 members who are appointed by the Minister for Justice and Equality
Tá naonúr comhaltaí ar an mBord Achomhairc um Aicmiú Scannán a cheapann an tAire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais
The decision of the Appeal Board is final, but the film may be re-submitted to IFCO after seven years
Tá cinneadh an Bhoird Achomhairc críochnaitheach, ach féadtar an scannán a chur faoi bhráid an OASÉ athuair i ndiaidh seacht mbliana
Offences and Penalties under the Censorship of Films Acts
Coireanna agus Pionóis faoi na hAchtanna um Chinsearacht Scannán

There are a number of offences under the Censorship of Films Acts, including exhibiting a film without a certificate, failing to comply with the terms of a restricted certificate and displaying publicity material that has not been approved by IFCO

Tá roinnt coireanna faoi na hAchtanna um Chinsireacht Scannán, san áireamh tá scannán a thaispeáint gan teastas, teip cloí le téarmaí an teastais teoranta agus ábhar bolscaireachta a thaispeáint nach bhfuil ceadaithe ag an OASÉ
It is also an offence in Ireland for a cinema to allow entry to a film by someone below the classified age
Tá athbhreithniú dhá dhéanamh faoi láthair ar na fíneálacha a bhaineann le sárú na nAchtanna
Records held by IFCO
Taifid coinnithe in OASÉ
Various registers, not all of which are computerised, are held by IFCO
Tá cláir éagsúla, nach bhfuil ar fad coinnithe ar ríomhaire, coinnithe in OASÉ
The Register of Films gives basic information for each film and trailer examined, including the certification
Tá buneolas ar fáil ar Chlár na Scannán maidir le gach scannán agus sliocht bolscaireachta a scrúdaíodh, an teastas a bronnadh san áireamh
The Cuts Register records details of cuts made in particular films and the Rejects Register gives details of prohibited films
Tá eolas maidir le píosaí a gearradh amach as scannáin faoi leith coinnithe ar Chlár na nGearrthacha agus sonraí ar Chlár na gColfairtí maidir le scannáin ar cuireadh cosc orthu
The Appeal Board Register records details of appeals and decisions made by the Classification of Films Appeal Board
Tá sonraí maidir le cinneadh a tógadh ar achomhairc ar Chlár Bhord na nAchomharc chomh maith le aon chinneadh a thóg Bord Achomhairc um Chinsearacht Scannán
There is also an Accounts and Payments Register
Tá Clár Cuntas agus Íocaíochtaí ann freisin
The above information may be examined at IFCO's Office
Is féidir an t-eolas thuasluaite a scrúdú in OASÉ
At present, no fee is charged for this service
Faoi láthair, níl aon táille le n-íoc as an tseirbhís seo
There is no fee for making a complaint to an Ombudsman
Ní ghearrtar aon táille ar ghearán a dhéanamh leis an Ombudsman
IFCO, (which is self-financing), charges fees to film distributors to offset the costs of certification and classification
Gearrann OASÉ, atá féin-mhaoinithe, táillí ar dháileoirí scannán leis na costais a bhaineann le teastais agus rangú a chlúdach
A distributor is not charged a fee if the film, in the opinion of IFCO, is an educational film
Ní ghearrtar táille ar dháileoir má cheapann an OASÉ gur scannán oideachasúil atá i gceist
The fee for appealing to the Classification of Films Appeals Board is €1,000
Tá athbhreithniú dhá dhéanamh faoi láthair ar an gcóras táillí reatha
